verses.verse: Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH136> God<WH3069>; The gate<WH8179> of the inner<WH6442> court<WH2691> that looks<WH6437> toward the east<WH6921> shall be shut<WH5462> the six<WH8337> working<WH4639> days<WH3117>; but on the sabbath<WH7676> it shall be opened<WH6605>, and in the day<WH3117> of the new moon<WH2320> it shall be opened<WH6605>.

And the prince<WH5387> shall enter<WH935> by the way<WH1870> of the porch<WH197> of that gate<WH8179> outside<WH2351>, and shall stand<WH5975> by the post<WH4201> of the gate<WH8179>, and the priests<WH3548> shall prepare<WH6213> his burnt offering<WH5930> and his peace offerings<WH8002>, and he shall worship<WH7812> at the threshold<WH4670> of the gate<WH8179>: then he shall go forth<WH3318>; but the gate<WH8179> shall not be shut<WH5462> until the evening<WH6153>.
Likewise the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> shall worship<WH7812> at the door<WH6607> of this gate<WH8179> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> in the sabbaths<WH7676> and in the new moons<WH2320>.

And the burnt offering<WH5930> that the prince<WH5387> shall offer<WH7126> unto the Lord<WH3068> in the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117> shall be six<WH8337> lambs<WH3532> without blemish<WH8549>, and a ram<WH352> without blemish<WH8549>.

And the food offering<WH4503> shall be a ephah<WH374> for a ram<WH352>, and the food offering<WH4503> for the lambs<WH3532> as he shall be able<WH3027> to give<WH4991>, and a hin<WH1969> of oil<WH8081> to a ephah<WH374>.

And in the day<WH3117> of the new moon<WH2320> it shall be a young<WH1121> bullock<WH6499> without blemish<WH8549>, and six<WH8337> lambs<WH3532>, and a ram<WH352>: they shall be without blemish<WH8549>.

And he shall prepare<WH6213> a food offering<WH4503>, an ephah<WH374> for a bullock<WH6499>, and an ephah<WH374> for a ram<WH352>, and for the lambs<WH3532> according as his hand<WH3027> shall be able<WH5381> to<WH1969>, and a hin of oil<WH8081> to an ephah<WH374>.
And when the prince<WH5387> shall enter<WH935>, he shall go<WH935> in by the way<WH1870> of the porch<WH197> of that gate<WH8179>, and he shall go forth<WH3318> by the way there<WH1870>.

But when the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> shall come<WH935> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> in the solemn feasts<WH4150>, he that enters<WH935> in by the way<WH1870> of the north<WH6828> gate<WH8179> to worship<WH7812> shall go out<WH3318> by the way<WH1870> of the south<WH5045> gate<WH8179>; and he that enters<WH935> by the way<WH1870> of the south<WH5045> gate<WH8179> shall go forth<WH3318> by the way<WH1870> of the north<WH6828> gate<WH8179>: he shall not return<WH7725> by the way<WH1870> of the gate<WH8179> by which he came in<WH935>, but shall go forth<WH3318> through the opposite gate<WH5226>.
And the prince<WH5387> in the midst<WH8432> of them<WH935>, when they go in, shall go in<WH935>; and when they go forth<WH3318>, shall go forth<WH3318>.

And in the feasts<WH2282> and in the solemnities<WH4150> the food offering<WH4503> shall be an ephah<WH374> to a bullock<WH6499>, and an ephah<WH374> to a ram<WH352>, and to the lambs<WH3532> as he is able<WH3027> to give<WH4991>, and a hin<WH1969> of oil<WH8081> to an ephah<WH374>.

Now when the prince<WH5387> shall prepare<WH6213> a voluntary<WH5071> burnt offering<WH5930> or peace offerings<WH8002> voluntarily<WH5071> unto the Lord<WH3068>, one shall then open<WH6605> him the gate<WH8179> that looks<WH6437> toward the east<WH6921>, and he shall prepare<WH6213> his burnt offering<WH5930> and his peace offerings<WH8002>, as he did<WH6213> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>: then he shall go forth<WH3318>; and after<WH310> his going forth<WH3318> one shall shut<WH5462> the gate<WH8179>.

You shall daily<WH3117> prepare<WH6213> a burnt offering<WH5930> unto the Lord<WH3068> of a lamb<WH3532> of the first<WH1121> year<WH8141> without blemish<WH8549>: you shall prepare<WH6213> it every<WH1242> morning<WH1242>.

And you shall prepare<WH6213> a food offering<WH4503> for it every morning<WH1242>, the sixth part<WH8345> of an ephah<WH374>, and the third part<WH7992> of a hin<WH1969> of oil<WH8081>, to temper with<WH7450> the fine flour<WH5560>; a food offering<WH4503> continually<WH8548> by a perpetual<WH5769> ordinance<WH2708> unto the Lord<WH3068>.
Thus shall they prepare<WH6213> the lamb<WH3532>, and the food offering<WH4503>, and the oil<WH8081>, every morning<WH1242> for a continual<WH8548> burnt offering<WH5930>.

Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH136> God<WH3069>; If the prince<WH5387> give<WH5414> a gift<WH4979> unto any<WH376> of his sons<WH1121>, the inheritance<WH5159> there shall be his sons<WH1121>'; it shall be their possession<WH272> by inheritance<WH5159>.

But if he give<WH5414> a gift<WH4979> of his inheritance<WH5159> to one<WH259> of his servants<WH5650>, then it shall be his to the year<WH8141> of liberty<WH1865>; after it shall return<WH7725> to the prince<WH5387>: but his inheritance<WH5159> shall be his sons<WH1121>' for them.

Moreover the prince<WH5387> shall not take<WH3947> of the people<WH5971>'s inheritance<WH5159> by oppression<WH3238>, to thrust<WH3238> them out of their possession<WH272>; but he shall give his sons<WH1121> inheritance<WH5157> out of his own possession<WH272>: that my people<WH5971> be not scattered<WH6327> every man<WH376> from his possession<WH272>.

After he brought<WH935> me through the entry<WH3996>, which was at the side<WH3802> of the gate<WH8179>, into the holy<WH6944> chambers<WH3957> of the priests<WH3548>, which looked<WH6437> toward the north<WH6828>: and<WH4725>, behold, there was a place on the two sides<WH3411> westward<WH3220>.

Then said<WH559> he unto me<WH4725>, This is the place where the priests<WH3548> shall boil<WH1310> the trespass offering<WH817> and the sin offering<WH2403>, where they shall bake<WH644> the food offering<WH4503>; that they bear<WH3318> them not out into the utter<WH2435> court<WH2691>, to sanctify<WH6942> the people<WH5971>.

Then he brought me forth<WH3318> into the outer<WH2435> court<WH2691>, and caused me to pass by<WH5674> the four<WH702> corners<WH4740> of the court<WH2691>; and<WH4740>, behold, in every corner<WH4740> of the court<WH2691> there was a court<WH2691>.

In the four<WH702> corners<WH4740> of the court<WH2691> there were courts<WH2691> joined<WH7000> of forty<WH705> cubits long<WH753> and thirty<WH7970> broad<WH7341>: these four<WH702> corners<WH7106> were of one<WH259> measure<WH4060>.

And there was a row<WH2905> of building round about<WH5439> in them<WH5439>, round about them four<WH702>, and it was made<WH6213> with boiling places<WH4018> under the rows<WH2918> round about<WH5439>.
Then said<WH559> he unto me<WH1004>, These are the places of them that boil<WH1310>, where the ministers<WH8334> of the house<WH1004> shall boil<WH1310> the sacrifice<WH2077> of the people<WH5971>.
